title: Author Gets Help from TV Show Success
summary: Rachel Reid is an author who wrote a book series called Game Changers. Her book Heated Rivalry was made into a TV show about ice hockey players. The show became very popular. Rachel has Parkinson's disease, which makes it hard for her to move and write. After people heard about her sickness from a TV interview, a Parkinson's expert reached out to help her. This expert found her a doctor and gave advice on medicine so she can sleep better. Now, Rachel might get better treatment because of the TV show's success. She is happy that something good came from all the attention.

background_read: Rachel Reid is a Canadian author who writes books about ice hockey players. She got sick with Parkinson's disease in 2023, which affects her movement and writing. Her book Heated Rivalry became a popular TV show, and this attention led to a Parkinson's expert offering help. This story shows how good things can happen from sharing personal challenges.
Article_Structure: WHO: Rachel Reid, an author with Parkinson's disease
WHAT: The success of her TV show led to medical help from an expert
WHERE: Canada and North America, with the show coming to the UK
WHY: To show how positive outcomes can arise from public attention on health issues

perspectives.description: Rachel's story highlights how sharing personal struggles can lead to unexpected help and improved health care.
